]] 'Transylvania' is a historical region in the central part of Romania. Bounded
on the east and south by the Carpathian mountain range, historical Transylvania
extended in the west to the Apuseni Mountains; however, the term sometimes
encompasses not only Transylvania proper, but also the historical regions of
CriÅana, MaramureÅ, and Romanian part of Banat.

Transylvania is often associated with vampires (chiefly due to Bram Stoker's novel
[[Dracula]] and its film adaptations) and the horror genre in general, while the
region is also known for the scenic beauty of its Carpathian landscape and its
rich history.
headings: Historical coat of arms of Transylvania
